MemberSignature.Value: public long Read (long offset, byte[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
.method public hidebysig instance int64 Read(int64 offset, unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offsetInBuffer, int32 count) cil managed
Public Function Read (offset As Long, buffer As Byte(), offsetInBuffer As Integer, count As Integer) As Long
public: long Read(long offset, cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
member this.Read : int64 * byte[] * int * int -> int64

Docs.param: An long value offset into the value that is contained in the instance.
The byte array buffer to copy into.
An integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An integer representing the number of bytes to copy.
Docs.summary: Copies bytes from this instance to the passed-in buffer and returns the number of copied bytes.
Docs.returns: An long value representing the number of copied bytes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If an attempt is made to read beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
If `count` specifies more bytes to be copied than are available from the `offset` to the end of the value, only the available bytes are copied.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer is a null reference.
An exception is thrown if the destination buffer cannot receive as many characters as requested.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data of this as a stream.
Docs.value: The stream that contains the SqlBytes data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Getting or setting the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Stream%2A> property loads all the data into memory. Using it with large value data can cause an <xref:System.OutOfMemoryException>.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Write (long offset, byte[] buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
.method public hidebysig instance void Write(int64 offset, unsigned int8[] buffer, int32 offsetInBuffer, int32 count) cil managed
Public Sub Write (offset As Long, buffer As Byte(), offsetInBuffer As Integer, count As Integer)
public: void Write(long offset, cli::array <System::Byte> ^ buffer, int offsetInBuffer, int count);
member this.Write : int64 * byte[] * int * int -> unit

Docs.param: An long value offset into the value that is contained in the instance.
The byte array buffer to copy into.
An integer offset into the buffer to start copying into.
An integer representing the number of bytes to copy.
Docs.summary: Copies bytes from the passed-in buffer to this instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this operation writes to a position beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Length%2A> but within <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.MaxLength%2A>, <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Length%2A> is updated to reflect the new ending position.
The value of `offsetInBuffer` must be less than or equal to <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.Length%2A>. An exception is thrown otherwise. Only a value of 0 can be specified when writing to a null value instance.
If an attempt is made to write beyond <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlBytes.MaxLength%2A>, an exception is thrown.
